text: Odysseus was the first to tell it, but the truth is that, before Odysseus knew Circe, Circe had warned Jason to be careful when passing through the island of the sirens: with their songs he would be thrown into the sea, or at least — she said — his ears would be swollen with wax or the argonauts would be ordered to hit him with a hammer. Jasson didn't want to care. The sirens, seeing him so jangly, did not sing to him, and so, cruelly, left him without a word. FIN 1969
title: Jasón
author: Enrique Anderson Imbert
